question.text: By an angiogram, it was analyzed that there is a restriction to the flow of blood in the blood vessels. Which of the following disease can arise due to such a medical condition?

options.text: Angina pectoris and coronary artery disease

solution.text:
Coronary artery disease (CAD): It is often referred to as atherosclerosis. It affects the vessels that supply blood to the heart muscle. In this condition, the lumen of arteries gradually becomes narrower due to the deposits of calcium, fat, cholesterol and fibrous tissues.

Angina (or Angina pectoris): Because of insufficient blood supply to heart muscles, a symptom of acute chest pain appears indicating decreased availability of oxygen to the heart muscles. It can occur in both sexes of any age but its occurrence increases with age.
